messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] BSA
messages.msgSnippet: ... Anybody that doesn t believe in god isn t a good citizen, and that if an atheist found a wallet on the ground they would pick it up plunder the money
messages.messageBody:
>Glen Schmidt, Dist. Comm. Chair then went on to >say,
"Anybody that>>doesn't believe in god isn't a >good
citizen, and that if an atheist>>found a wallet >on
the ground they would pick it up plunder the money
>>and throw the wallet back on the ground."

This kind of person really scares me. He is a
fundamental Christian who believes in his own self
righteousness more than in the teachings of his faith.
He is a hate monger. What if he ever has a crisis of
faith? What might he be capable of? He firmly
believes that the only think keeping human beings from
committing crimes against each other is the fear of
Hell and the righteous wrath of the judgemental god
that he prays to.

There are two kinds of Chrisitan God, and you can
usually tell by a person'a action which type they
believe in. There is the forgiving all father, the
loving and peaceful Christ who loves all equally.
Then there is the fire and brimstone judgement
bringer, who casts out the unworthy and shuns the
non-white, oppressing women and heaping sin upon
humanity. I say those who embrace that second vision
of the Christian God are full of guilt and shame
themselves, and crave punishment. Wonder what
skeletons that Scout Director has in his closet....

Nanci K.
